GetOperations.Name: Get
GetOperations.Description: Gets information about the specified Batch account.

CreateOperations.Name: CreateOrUpdate
CreateOperations.Description: Creates a new Batch account with the specified parameters. Existing accounts cannot be updated with this API and should instead be updated with the Update Batch Account API.

UpdateOperations.Name: Update
UpdateOperations.Description: Updates the properties of an existing Batch account.

ListOperations.Name: GetAll
ListOperations.Description: Gets information about the Batch accounts associated with the specified resource group.

OperationsFromSubscriptionExtension.Name: GetBatchAccounts
OperationsFromSubscriptionExtension.Description: Gets information about the Batch accounts associated with the subscription.

OtherOperations.Name: SynchronizeAutoStorageKeys
OtherOperations.Description: Synchronizes access keys for the auto-storage account configured for the specified Batch account, only if storage key authentication is being used.

OtherOperations.Name: RegenerateKey
OtherOperations.Description: This operation applies only to Batch accounts with allowedAuthenticationModes containing 'SharedKey'. If the Batch account doesn't contain 'SharedKey' in its allowedAuthenticationMode, clients cannot use shared keys to authenticate, and must use another allowedAuthenticationModes instead. In this case, regenerating the keys will fail.

OtherOperations.Name: GetKeys
OtherOperations.Description: This operation applies only to Batch accounts with allowedAuthenticationModes containing 'SharedKey'. If the Batch account doesn't contain 'SharedKey' in its allowedAuthenticationMode, clients cannot use shared keys to authenticate, and must use another allowedAuthenticationModes instead. In this case, getting the keys will fail.

OtherOperations.Name: GetOutboundNetworkDependenciesEndpoints
OtherOperations.Description: Lists the endpoints that a Batch Compute Node under this Batch Account may call as part of Batch service administration. If you are deploying a Pool inside of a virtual network that you specify, you must make sure your network allows outbound access to these endpoints. Failure to allow access to these endpoints may cause Batch to mark the affected nodes as unusable. For more information about creating a pool inside of a virtual network, see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/batch/batch-virtual-network.

GetOperations.Name: Get
GetOperations.Description: Gets information about the given detector for a given Batch account.

ListOperations.Name: GetAll
ListOperations.Description: Gets information about the detectors available for a given Batch account.

GetOperations.Name: Get
GetOperations.Description: Gets information about the specified application package.

CreateOperations.Name: CreateOrUpdate
CreateOperations.Description: Creates an application package record. The record contains a storageUrl where the package should be uploaded to.  Once it is uploaded the `ApplicationPackage` needs to be activated using `ApplicationPackageActive` before it can be used. If the auto storage account was configured to use storage keys, the URL returned will contain a SAS.

UpdateOperations.Name: Update
UpdateOperations.Description: Creates an application package record. The record contains a storageUrl where the package should be uploaded to.  Once it is uploaded the `ApplicationPackage` needs to be activated using `ApplicationPackageActive` before it can be used. If the auto storage account was configured to use storage keys, the URL returned will contain a SAS.

DeleteOperations.Name: Delete
DeleteOperations.Description: Deletes an application package record and its associated binary file.

ListOperations.Name: GetAll
ListOperations.Description: Lists all of the application packages in the specified application.

OtherOperations.Name: Activate
OtherOperations.Description: Activates the specified application package. This should be done after the `ApplicationPackage` was created and uploaded. This needs to be done before an `ApplicationPackage` can be used on Pools or Tasks.

GetOperations.Name: Get
GetOperations.Description: Gets information about the specified application.

CreateOperations.Name: CreateOrUpdate
CreateOperations.Description: Adds an application to the specified Batch account.

UpdateOperations.Name: Update
UpdateOperations.Description: Updates settings for the specified application.

ListOperations.Name: GetAll
ListOperations.Description: Lists all of the applications in the specified account.

GetOperations.Name: Get
GetOperations.Description: Warning: This operation is deprecated and will be removed after February, 2024. Please use the [Azure KeyVault Extension](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-certificate-migration-guide) instead.

CreateOperations.Name: CreateOrUpdate
CreateOperations.Description: Warning: This operation is deprecated and will be removed after February, 2024. Please use the [Azure KeyVault Extension](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-certificate-migration-guide) instead.

UpdateOperations.Name: Update
UpdateOperations.Description: Warning: This operation is deprecated and will be removed after February, 2024. Please use the [Azure KeyVault Extension](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-certificate-migration-guide) instead.

DeleteOperations.Name: Delete
DeleteOperations.Description: Warning: This operation is deprecated and will be removed after February, 2024. Please use the [Azure KeyVault Extension](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-certificate-migration-guide) instead.

ListOperations.Name: GetAll
ListOperations.Description: Warning: This operation is deprecated and will be removed after February, 2024. Please use the [Azure KeyVault Extension](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-certificate-migration-guide) instead.

OtherOperations.Name: CancelDeletion
OtherOperations.Description:
If you try to delete a certificate that is being used by a pool or compute node, the status of the certificate changes to deleteFailed. If you decide that you want to continue using the certificate, you can use this operation to set the status of the certificate back to active. If you intend to delete the certificate, you do not need to run this operation after the deletion failed. You must make sure that the certificate is not being used by any resources, and then you can try again to delete the certificate.

Warning: This operation is deprecated and will be removed after February, 2024. Please use the [Azure KeyVault Extension](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-certificate-migration-guide) instead.

GetOperations.Name: Get
GetOperations.Description: Gets information about the specified private link resource.

ListOperations.Name: GetAll
ListOperations.Description: Lists all of the private link resources in the specified account.

GetOperations.Name: Get
GetOperations.Description: Gets information about the specified private endpoint connection.

UpdateOperations.Name: Update
UpdateOperations.Description: Updates the properties of an existing private endpoint connection.

DeleteOperations.Name: Delete
DeleteOperations.Description: Deletes the specified private endpoint connection.

ListOperations.Name: GetAll
ListOperations.Description: Lists all of the private endpoint connections in the specified account.

GetOperations.Name: Get
GetOperations.Description: Gets information about the specified pool.

CreateOperations.Name: CreateOrUpdate
CreateOperations.Description: Creates a new pool inside the specified account.

UpdateOperations.Name: Update
UpdateOperations.Description: Updates the properties of an existing pool.

ListOperations.Name: GetAll
ListOperations.Description: Lists all of the pools in the specified account.

OtherOperations.Name: DisableAutoScale
OtherOperations.Description: Disables automatic scaling for a pool.

OtherOperations.Name: StopResize
OtherOperations.Description: This does not restore the pool to its previous state before the resize operation: it only stops any further changes being made, and the pool maintains its current state. After stopping, the pool stabilizes at the number of nodes it was at when the stop operation was done. During the stop operation, the pool allocation state changes first to stopping and then to steady. A resize operation need not be an explicit resize pool request; this API can also be used to halt the initial sizing of the pool when it is created.
